solution_line_template: Pirate Rick digs at a rate of {initial_sand_depth} feet of sand per {initial_digging_time} hours, or {initial_sand_depth}/{initial_digging_time}=<<{initial_sand_depth}/{initial_digging_time}={digging_rate}>>{digging_rate} feet per hour.

Of the {initial_sand_depth} feet of sand that were initially on top of the treasure, the storm washed {initial_sand_depth}/{storm_wash_divisor}=<<{initial_sand_depth}/{storm_wash_divisor}={sand_washed_away}>>{sand_washed_away} feet of sand away.

Thus, after the storm and the tsunami, the treasure was buried beneath {initial_sand_depth}-{sand_washed_away}+{tsunami_added_sand}=<<{initial_sand_depth}-{sand_washed_away}+{tsunami_added_sand}={final_sand_depth}>>{final_sand_depth} feet of sand.
Digging at a rate of {digging_rate} feet per hour, Pirate Rick could uncover his treasure in {final_sand_depth}/{digging_rate}={time_to_uncover} hours.
